mappedQuestions.reasoning: Question asks to interpret a correlation coefficient of -0.85 (Strong negative relationship).
Question asks for the definition of Type I error (rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true).
Question asks to identify the independent variable in a described experiment (the intervention being manipulated).
Question asks to identify a threat to internal validity where participants drop out of the study (Attrition/Mortality).
Question asks for the appropriate statistical test to compare the means of two distinct groups (Independent t-test).
Question asks to interpret a Cohen's d value of 0.80 (Large effect size), testing practical significance.
Question asks for the correct test to compare means across three or more groups (ANOVA).
Question asks to identify the specific single-subject design being used (A-B-A-B Reversal Design).
Question asks for the statistical measure that describes the spread or variability of scores around the mean (Standard Deviation).
Question asks for the primary purpose of random assignment in experimental design (to ensure groups are equivalent/control extraneous variables).

suggestedNewSkills.name: Statistical Test Selection
suggestedNewSkills.description: Select the appropriate statistical test (t-test, ANOVA, Chi-square, correlation) based on the research question and data type.
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer matches 2 groups → t-test, 3+ groups → ANOVA, categorical data → Chi-square.

suggestedNewSkills.name: Descriptive Statistics
suggestedNewSkills.description: Understand and interpret measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode) and dispersion (range, variance, standard deviation).
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer identifies the measure that best summarizes the data set's center or spread.

suggestedNewSkills.name: Variable Identification
suggestedNewSkills.description: Distinguish between Independent Variables (manipulated) and Dependent Variables (measured outcome) in research scenarios.
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer identifies the 'cause' (IV) or the 'effect' (DV) correctly.

suggestedNewSkills.name: Research Validity Threats
suggestedNewSkills.description: Identify threats to internal validity (history, maturation, attrition) and external validity (generalizability).
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer links a specific confounding factor (e.g., dropping out) to the correct validity threat (e.g., attrition).
